intro: Ferulago westii, commonly known as the Westii Ferulago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Ferulago westii is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
